title: Great camera, but software download is hard to find
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
text: Great camera at a decent price. You will definitely want to download the Logi Tune software from Logitech to optimize your camera settings, and it isn't easy to find. If you register your product with the serial number found on the shipping box you will be taken to a link. Otherwise hover over the Support button on the Logitech website and select Logi Tune in the Software list. Do not select Downloads under the For Individuals list because you won't find it there. Software is available for Windows and Mac, and the Mac version works fine on Apple silicon (reboot after installation). I'm taking a star off the rating for the difficulty of finding and downloading the software.

title: It's ok and works fairly well
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 10, 2022
text: First of all, this camera does what it's supposed to, for the most part.  It doesn't look like webcams have evolved much at all in the past 15 years, so this camera appears to be as good as any available.However, the auto focus doesn't work very well at all.  Many times my camera is out of focus and I have to move around until it re-focuses.There is no privacy cover included.  The base for the camera is terrible for two reasons - 1) I have new monitors with very slim edges and this camera's mount is thick enough that it covers the top edge of my viewing area on the screen.  2) The mount doesn't seem to double as a traditional desktop stand.  Maybe I'm just missing something, but I don't think it can just stand on the desk in a good way that doesn't require a separate tripod stand.Overall, this feels like another mass-produced product with very little thought put into the design and execution.The worst part is that I don't think it's worth returning it because I don't see any other webcams available that look like they've evolved past the 90's designs.  Literally every laptop I've used with built-in webcam has worked better than this camera.I don't recommend this camera for the price.  It might be ok if the price were around 80% less than the current price.  It's really very basic and just performs adequately.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black

title: Nice Webcam but Autofocus Frustrating
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2023
text: I purchase this camera for online teaching.  I use it to demo art lessons.  I like the quality of the video, it is crisp and clear and captures colors accurately.  However, the autofocus is incredibly frustrating.  Any time I would move my hand (something that you need to do frequently when teaching art) the camera would go out of focus and have a difficult time readjusting.  Naturally the camera does not come with any instructions.  After doing extensive research I discovered that you can download Logitech's LogiTune software (from their website).  The software allows you to control the zoom, override auto-focus and other features.  So far, so good.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Good colors, bad auto focus
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
text: I've always loved Logitech everything so I figured this would be good even at a little lower price than some. But no. The color is good, end works well enough with the low light setting. The auto focus, however, is absolute crap. I stream on Twitch and use it for both face cam and art streams and it feels like I'm constantly fighting it go get the focus right. It'll hold focus then one movement will make it unfocus and that's it. I've messed with the manual focus but that's not good at all either.If I'd known how bad it would be (didn't use it much right after buying it, my own mistake) I would have returned it but now I just have it and I'll figure out some other use for it. I'll be saving up some money to get one that works better (and will test it right away) but I'm rather hesitant to get another Logitech for it.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Life Cam Studio vs. Logitech C270 vs. Logitech C920
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 25, 2022
text: TL;DR - C920 has best image quality, but C270 is a better value proposition. All three cameras stream video at 720p unless you are using Zoom, in which case the C920 is capable of 1080p. C270 captures less background due to smaller sensor, not as good if you are trying to record an activity or more than one person but better if you are trying to only capture your head and shoulders for work meetings.I ordered the LifeCam Studio($64), Logitech C270($22.99), and Logitech C920x($59.99 with $10 'limited time' discount) cameras to compare. All three cameras worked immediately upon being plugged in on a Windows 10 Enterprise laptop from Dell. I will be posting this review on all three cameras.All three of these cameras stream at 720p using WebEx, and indeed the fine print on the LCS and C920 state '720p video calls', so they are not capable of streaming at 1080p despite the 1920x1080 sensor (C920 can do 1080p with Skype only). My limited testing was using the drivers Windows assigned upon plugging in the devices in a relatively high-light environment. I will update with observations in low-light scenarios.C270: The cheapest of the cameras with a 1280x720 sensor, this camera had the worst color accuracy but surprisingly decent picture quality in terms of sharpness considering price. As seen on the photos, there is a blue tint to the image but that may not be the case in low-light environments with warm light. Since it has a native 720 sensor, it looks a little more zoomed-in than the other two, but that means less background which I actually prefer. ** I'm cheap when it comes to equipment I'm buying myself for work and the other cameras didn't offer sufficiently better performance, so I'm keeping this camera. **C920x: Best color accuracy, best picture. You can tell it has a 1080 sensor as there is a lot more background than the C270, I don't want more background so this is a tick against in my view.Life Cam Studio: Color accuracy is off, in high-light environment it gives a reddish tint and makes my face look like I'm flushing.. but you can tell I'm not from the other pictures. Again, 1080 sensor includes more of the background which I didn't want for WebEx meetings. I was also disappointed with the auto-focus, picture is a little blurry even after auto-focus does its thing (which is sporadic, I was blurry for a while before it did anything)

text: This is a simple plug and play camera with a built in microphone.  The two issues  I have found is that there is no camera cover and I would like a way to reduce the background span without the use of greenscreen or outside app. I usually use my laptop with built in camera  for Teams, Webex, and Zoom meetings, but my 75 year old mother just started chemo and I wanted to do recorded chats with her every week to record a video history of her life so I wanted a better camera.  I have been very pleased with the video and audio of the sessions I have already recorded but I have only used it in Zoom but I would imagine the same quality would apply to Teams and Webex.  Other than the original two points I would recommend this little camera.

title: Just got it. Fantastic. Good color.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 13, 2021
text: This didnt come on when I put it on regular camera. My old one came up that is installed in the computer. It just said audio under settings. So I was like where is the video . The zoom meeting was amazing. I am a zumba instructor and  I didnt have issues with focus  .  I was taking another instructors class a couple of hours ago. The light came right on right before her class when I was in my own meeting to test it out. I may need a mic for teaching my own classes but they seemed to hear me fine after her class. Just for clarity with my intro and after class speech I might upgrade. It is hard to hear other instructors whatever they have  so ill do what I have to do. It look amazing clear compared to yesterday in my bedroom. I will teach in the family so I see how that does. It semed to show more of my room like movie bluray movies behind me and the window a bit more. So may be that is the wide view. On there screen I didnt notice it as much. Maybe when they share the screen. I wasnt really looking I was dancing . I just saw how much brighter I was and the colors were hitting perfect. I turned down the brightness on my PC. So I took the glare  off . No washed out colors . Everything seemed pretty clear and true to my outfit and skin tone. I even could see the hair on my face well. As another reviewer said. I shaved before class. I had whiskers everywhere.  It really picks everything up. Dresser was deep brown. My lava lamp was on point. I could see the top of it. I have that good view now. The computer cam seems dark in comparison. And with the adjust to low light on. Or should've been on.Update: The camera comes on in camera mode if you click on the camera in the upper right corner. It switches from your installed computer camera. So It works that was and on zoom. Previously it just said audio in the settings with no picture . No image. Then it came on zoom and looked perfectly clear. Now it works on both. Camera and zoom.

title: Really Great >$100 Camera!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 15, 2021
text: What a great camera this is! Great price too at a time when webcams have become like Bigfoot...many reports of their existence but only a few people have actually found one lol.After reading from others I was a little concerned about this being a legit C920. Many places around the web claim it's a Chinese clone but after receiving it, there's no doubt it's a Logitech webcam. The box has Logitech product code and Logitech instructions are included.I read one reply from a Logitech associate that stated the C920x is not an official product. That leads me to believe this is a promo item or something. Clearly it isn't packaged in a retail box designed for shelf display. It's no doubt a C920 though ith the addition of a free trial of Xsplit. I don't have any desire to try or use Xsplit but I'm happy I was able to grab a C920 cam for just $70, which is $10 lower than current MSRP and about $20-$30 lower than the camera is selling elsewhere.The only thing I can figure about other reviews here stating it's blurry or auto focus doesn't work is they either got a bad camera or need to change their lighting or settings. This thing is crystal clear! It picks up every line and blemish on my face so...it may be a little too clear, revealing my age lol. When dialed in under the right lighting, it picks up individual hairs on my head and beard stubble. If you have a good front light, placed just behind the camera and no overly bright lights behind you and you're having problems with the image or focus then I would suggest that you simply are unlucky enough to have gotten an individually defective camera....it happens. I use a 10" ring light in front, a lesser bright fill light on the side and indirect, colored led light behind and the image is perfect! 1080 is nearly as good an image as my daughter's DSLR camera... NEARLY! Not bad for a $70 camera vs $700 camera

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Great, reliable camera
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 12, 2021
text: This is my second C920x Pro after I gave the first one to my wife. I originally bought this to use my larger monitor as my primary but not have my everyone looking at the side of my head during zoom calls. It's very easy to set up and the separately installable Logi Capture software works relatively well. It allows you to add effects like frames or text and digitally zoom in. You can then select the Logi Capture video feed in conferencing apps and will get the adjusted view. I use this to zoom in since my monitor is not as close to me as a laptop would normally be. However, I do not like that the Capture software is permanently recording (hence the blue lights on the webcam). There might be a way to have it automatically start when a zoom/teams/webex/whatever meeting starts but I haven't found it yet.Overall, picture quality and autofocusing has been good. I know one person who had issues with autofocusing but it turned out to be a hardware defect and they got it replaced. I know several who have had this camera for many years and my older, 1.5 year old camera is just as good as this new one.The original one I bought had a privacy screen included but this does not. That's unfortunate but easy enough to create a makeshift one. Plus the blue lights make it clear when the camera is supposed to be live.I have never used the speakers on this camera and generally do not use the microphone since I have a dedicated mic. In the few cases that I have, people have preferred it to the built-in laptop one which had a lot of static.The USB cable is adequately long so it will work just fine for desktop users. Unfortunately, the cable is not replaceable so when my cat chews through this it will be time for a new webcam.

text: I have an older version of this camera that this one replaced. I moved my older version to my work computer and put this on my primary personal computer.First, compared to the older version, the USB cable is MUCH shorter. The older one's cable is about twice as long.Second, there is some weird auto focus issue. I will move quickly (scratch my nose or something) and it will try and refocus (which is fine), but then the image never goes back into focus. Restarting the video feed seems to fix this issue.Third, every once and awhile it was "half" disconnect. What I mean by this is that the video being sent will get distorted and the bottom half will just be a gray box while the top half of the feed will look like it's trying to squeeze me all into it. Restarting the video feed fixes this issue.

text: [For reference: I'm tech savvy enough to Google necessary drivers and install them, but I'm not savvy enough to be able to compare this cam model to other models.]I wanted something simple for video and audio calls, with a 1080p minimum resolution and an integrated mic.The time it took to install the camera was half the time it took to undo the twist tie in the packaging.On the inside of the box, there are IKEA-esque instructions. (picture included)No drivers were necessary, just plug and play.I tried it out in a Discord call, with a Nitro subscription.The person on the receiving end of the call said the video came through clear, and the audio was clear as well.On my end I saw that my video was backwards / reversed, but it WAS NOT reversed for the person receiving the video.The auto-focus is a little annoying when I adjust the lighting in the room, but not annoying enough for me to make a big fuss.I also feared any inherent fisheye effect, but luckily there was nothing of the sort.I'm overall super pleased with the purchase! I'll most likely update this in the future if anything major changes.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Easy To Use And Great Quality. Just Plug It In And Get Started!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
text: I was a little hesitant to purchase a webcam because of just how many models are on the market. I recently updated my home office and didn't want complex set-ups OR high price points.I'm happy to say this webcam more than met my expectations. I use a Dell XPS 8940 with Windows 10 Pro -- the webcam plugs into a USB slot and starts working instantly. No fiddling around with drivers or installing new programs. I was stunned when I opened up my video window and saw my face! I was like, "...That's it? It just works right off the bat? Cool!"I've conducted several Zoom and Google Meet calls since and the audio/video quality has been very consistent. There's the occasional glitch or freeze, sure, but that's to be expected with any webcam (and especially when you have decent-to-average Internet). 95% of the time everything runs without a hitch. ***The only thing I recommend is removing the virtual backgrounds: the webcam's video quality tends to freeze more when it's on.***If you're on a budget and want a webcam that works immediately and consistently, get this model ASAP.

text: The Logitech C920x HD Pro is more than enough for basic zoom calls, business meetings, etc. I feel the camera itself is relatively fine for the price, and what it offers. product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Well-designed, well-built, well-supported
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020
text: I bought one of these for my wife after using one myself for several years. I teach online so my camera gets constant use. The image quality is terrific, especially after using the setup software to increase the camera resolution. The camera is plug-and-play, requiring no setup in either Windows or Ubuntu Linux. The only minor complaints I have are that images are dim in low light (make sure your face is well-lit from the front!) and that it occasionally re-focuses spontaneously and causes a few seconds of blurred video. But 99 percent of the time the image is excellent.Audio quality is very good too, but the microphone can be overdriven, causing distorted sound. This is seldom a problem for voice calls but if you're using it for something louder like an acoustic instrument you should turn down the microphone gain in either the camera setup or the application itself, and make sure from the person on the other end that they're not hearing distortion. With the mic properly set you get decent audio fidelity, no matter what your sound source is.My biggest complaint about this webcam has nothing to do with the device itself. It's too popular. It's almost always sold out at the Logitech store, and when they do make some available, they are snapped up by resellers who scalp them at a $15-$30 premium. It would be helpful if Logitech would limit the number people could buy to give more people a chance to get this great camera at a more reasonable price.

title: Great camera, cuts out background noise
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
text: I bought this camera to use with my work's video conferencing platform. I was using another one I had bought on Amazon that was not a familiar brand and it came with no software. It was just a plug-and-play and I had no way to check the camera before my meeting. This camera comes with software (which I do not fully utilize but it has a lot of options) and I was able to get the picture as I wanted.What came as a really nice surprise was the quality of the microphone. My other camera could not cut out background noise. My home office has a pellet stove in it which can get a bit loud when the fire is roaring. I used to have to turn it off during my meetings which allowed my office to get cold so it was uncomfortable. I was using this camera and had a unplanned meeting and apologized for the stove noise in the background. The other person said they can only hear me and I'm coming through loud and clear. So that was a big win for me. It also cuts out my pets if they're not right next to me and in the other room.I also like the look of this camera and it's easy to tell when it's on and off. The picture quality is very nice and I never have any issues of a fuzzy/out-of-focus picture. I can recommend this camera to anyone who has a lot of video meetings with background noise. It's excellent!

title: No software included
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2022
text: I have been using a Logitech C920s successfully since November 2019. When I needed an additional webcam for a laptop, I decided to get another one. When I landed on the page for the C920s, there was a new version available, the C920x. I decided to buy the newer version.The C920x looks identical to the C920s except that it doesn't have a privacy shade. When the C920x arrived and I plugged it in, there was no Plug 'n' Play download. When I went to the Logitech web page for the C920x, it said no software, no documentation, no ... etc.The C920x has VERY limited settings controls. The picture quality was terrible and with the available adjustments, I couldn't get acceptable picture quality.What did come with the C920x was a license key for a three-month license of XSplit VCam software, which would give me the controls I needed: brightness, contrast, hue, etc. I went to the XSplit website to find out more. Sometimes, it is helpful to read the 1 Star ratings, and the ones for VCam were pretty withering. And when a product gets 22% 1 Star ratings, that is usually a no-go for me.After more poking around, I found some advice from a reviewer that I will pass along:Go to the Logitech websiteClick on the Downloads tabDownload and install LogiTuneIt isn't as good as Logitech Camera Settings and Logitech Capture that came with my C920s, but it will give you the ability to adjust the picture quality.I would STRONGLY urge Logitech to end their agreement with XSplit and send buyers of the C920x the software that comes with the C920s.Update: You CAN find Logitech Camera Settings software on the Logitech website, but you need to look for it. If, in Support, you navigate to C920x and select Downloads, you won't find it. That's because the website pre-selects Windows 11. Change that to Windows 10 and there it is!

text: As a Techie guy, I was able to muddle through a setup issue as so many of the purchasers of this camera have. There were no troubleshooting  procedures included, only small pictures on how to install.this camera.My issue was that after plugging in a camera to a 2.0 Hub where several other USB devices were connected, I could not get the camera to communicate, even after downloading the software update from the Logitech link. When I connected the Camera's USB cable to a USB port direct to the Laptop (Dell Studio 17), the camera then communicated. I was able to then go into the Camera settings and Turn Off the Dell's integrated Web Camera then select the C920X camera.Very nice wide angle and bright output with minimal lighting conditions. Settings are intuitive. As with any software driven product that  is newly installed, always download the latest drivers for that product. I did not have a need to install the G-Hub software at this time as I did not need those extra features.

title: Gets the job done
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
text: The webcam works properly when the PC OS has no corrupted files.  The Logitech technical support staff has limited knowledge about the interaction between the webcam and the PC.  If in doubt, they will first verify your webcam warranty is in effect.  If it isn't, the staff will say, "You need to replace your webcam."  This is sometimes true, but it is not in your best interests and is the reason I gave a four-star rating.  It isn't always the webcam that is at fault if the PC isn't displaying the webcam's image or the webcam isn't activating.  If the webcam works on other PCs, then your PC may have a corrupt file in the OS.  Run the DISM feature on Windows (use PowerShell) to repair these files and then try your webcam again.

title: How to Fix it‚ÄîMore or Less...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
text: I was at first desperately disappointed with this camera.  Sharp image?  It was AWFUL.Ah, but there is a 'fix'‚Äîkinda'.  At least for the Mac:The big problem is not actually the camera itself, but the truly unusable software LogiTech provides to control it.If you download and use the LogiTech "Camera Settings" or the "Logi Capture" from the LogiTech website, you'll have nothing but trouble.  What a couple of stupid, inferior applications.  Instead, you need to find a 'third-party' camera settings app.I downloaded an eight-dollar app from the Apple Store (since I'm using a Mac).  It is called, astoundingly, "Webcam Settings".Now the camera works much better.  In fact... WAYYY better.  I even added a 'star'.Among other features in this Webcam Settings app, there is a "sharpen" tool.  This greatly helps clearing up the image.Two problems left to solve:1)  I have not seen any improvement by using 60fps instead of 30fps.  The motion remains blurry.To qote LogiTech Support: "Logitech Capture is not compatible with Big Sur, any changes will not work on Capture. You may try third party app to adjust the fps. Thanks."Yeah, thanks.2)  The camera still does not have the clarity of a real camera, and the background remains "noisy" with lots of grain floating around, even when the image is filled with light.~  ~  ~Ah, webcams.  Why can't anyone make a good one with excellent software?  LogiTech, are you reading your reviews?  Do you WANT to sell your products?  I would have bought the Brio if it were not for the negative reviews!  FIX YOUR SOFTWARE!(Pssst!  Many of those problems people have with the LogiTech Brio might be solved if they use some decent cheap-o third-party software! That may be the top camera after all...)

text: The camera itself works well and has great picture quality and clearly. The microphone on it is not the best but I feel like most people don't buy the camera for the microphone. title: Most expensive of my three compares - and I chose this one
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 29, 2021
text: Seems webcams all have the same specifications, but they don't have the same picture quality. I compared three webcams a $10 Amazon warehouse camera, a $30 camera, and this $70 camera.The $10 camera was worth every penny. OK so that's not exactly a compliment, but it worked fine, with poor resolution.The $30 camera was a decent choice, but it had a prominent fisheye effect when compared to this camera, and it did some filtering of some sort that eliminated details on my face. It would have been a good option for many.This camera showed better details on my face, and didn't have the fisheye effect.I think these webcams are way over priced for what they do, but it is what it is, and this camera had a significantly better picture quality than the $30 (and yes the $10 too). Notably Amazon didn't ask if it was a good value like it did on the $30 camera.

text: I spent most of a Saturday trying to get my Nikon D5500 to work as a Webcam. I had to spend $150 on a USB capture device and a special cable. It worked but it was a hassle getting it set up. Most webcam apps didn't work. My Nikon shuts off every 30 minutes unless I remember to touch a button before it shuts off. The last time I tried to get it to work I gave up and ordered this C920. I logged into Zoom, went to settings and tested the camera. No picture at first so I was worried this was going to be a trial & error like my Nikon setup. But then I realized that I forgot to plug the camera into USB. So I plugged it in and I had a picture before I could turn my head back to the computer screen. It could not have been easier. For about half the price of buying parts to get my Nikon to work intermittently I have a webcam that installed itself.

title: Greatest Cam for Zoom Meetings  - Turn off Auto Focus
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
text: This is probably the best Webcam for JW Christian Zoom Meetings, for the price.The Logitech Control Software is a 100% must and can be difficult to find. For some reason Logitech does not make it easy.So once you find the Logitech Control Software install it.1) Start Zoom and set C920 as camera in the settings on lower left.2) Open Logitech  Control software (If you open Logitech software before Zoom, Zoom can't take control of the camera and you have no image for Zoom)3) In Logitech Control go to advance and turn off autofocus, autofocus will constantly adjust with even small movements. Also you can PZT from Logitech Control, pan, zoom, tilt.The cam has a great image and very nice mic.For the price, best cam there is.

text: This a great little web cam I bought one a few years ago to use with my Mac mini so I could face time with friends the video and sound quality are really good. text: It's not unusual for a Logitech product to be extremely reliable and good quality, and this camera is no different. After using borrowing one of these webcams for about a year from elsewhere and needing to return it, I thought perhaps I would try another, cheaper product that had the same technical specifications. Boy, did I learn that although they may have the same numbers, the quality can differ greatly. I almost immediately returned the other camera and had no qualms about spending the money for the C920x. While Logitech Capture is very useful, you must set your video input to Logitech Capture or your video will broadcast without your custom settings. I'm not sure what Logitech were thinking.Otherwise, great webcam.

title: Plug and Play, couldn't be easier
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 27, 2021
text: Literal plug and play - what could be eaiser?  I had a significantly older Logitech camera and wanted to upgrade, it's rather amazing the difference a few years makes in terms of technology, clarity of the picture, ease of use, etc.  I plugged in the USB, positioned it on my PC display, and away we go.  That was it.  I regularly participate in multiple zoom type meetings and it's interesting to look at other people's videos, people using tablets or phones for the conferences, and to notice how ULTRA clear my video is compared to theirs.  I've had several people comment, "Look how CLEAR that is!"Grab one of these while you can - when the pandemic first hit they were impossible to find, took almost a year for them to be available again.

title: Terrible camera
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
text: I used a Logitech C910 for over ten years when recently it stopped working. I suspect some driver issue due to a Windows Update that I could probably have figured out, but I figured it has been over ten years, so I should "upgrade" to the latest and greatest.I mention this because it means I have over ten years of experience using a very similar Logitech camera with the same software and in the same exact space with exactly the same lighting and thus have very realistic expectations of how the camera should work. I have also used built-in laptop cams in the same space without these issues.Here is a list of some of the horrible things about the C920x:- Image color balance, brightness, etc. are awful. On camera, my face is either glowing red or bright white rather than the correct, natural skin tone.- Auto-focus frequently gets confused and blurs everything out. It seems like me slightly moving will trigger this and then I have to make big movements in front of the camera to get it to correct the focus. I have coworkers who have the same camera and same issue and any time it happens, you know instantly what camera they have.- The app to adjust the camera settings for things like pan, zoom, color balance, brightness, etc. forgets settings often. With the old camera, I could zoom and pan in the settings app to get myself situated in the proper position and then any app I used would have this correct position. That works for a little while with the new cam, but it eventually reverts back. This is an even bigger issue given the above mentioned color balance, brightness, etc. issue as I can make this slightly better (but not as good as the old camera) in the settings app, but it'll eventually lose these tweaks and suddenly I'm zoomed out and glowing red on a meeting.- No driver or settings app updates in years. It seems like this camera has been abandoned by Logitech and they have no interest in fixing these issues.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: No included lens cover but overall a great webcam
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2021
text: I also bought a 6 foot USB extension to add to the 5 foot USB cable that is attached to this unit. I tested its features on Zoom but I'm sure it'll work as well using Teams, Skype or any other similar program. The field of view is fairly wide and the image is very clear. The unit fits and adjusts for up and down angle very easily on a 25.5-inch ASUS monitor. The mounting design of this webcam makes it very adjustable for different thicknesses and sizes of monitors. I made a crude but effective sliding lens cover out of a chunk of polyethylene I had in the garage.This is a very good webcam for money and quality is as expected by Logitech.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: "Clear Stereo Audio" in the product description is misleading. It does not have speakers.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2022
text: The camera and microphone seem to work fine.  The product description should replace "Clear Stereo Audio" with "Clear Stereo Microphones" given there are no speakers in this device.  Yes, no speakers even though the grillage on each side of the camera AND the description would leave you to believe otherwise.  Message to marketing managers of this product, most people will think "stereo" refers to speakers.  Think about it, having "stereo" microphones is not an audio element for the person with this device since you are not listening to yourself.  While the stereo mics may make you sound good, there is no audio experience for the owners of the camera created by this speakerless product.  Please correct your advertising.

text: I had this item on my wish list for a couple of years when the pandemic hit out of nowhere. Knowing I'd be working from home from March 2020 'til TBD, I thought I'd better purchase this webcam. Lo and behold, they were either sold out or other nefarious sellers were selling it for double and triple the price. So I waited patiently. Finally, in January 2021, they were restocked at their normal price. I couldn't be more pleased. The camera quality is second to none. The mic sounds good, too. However, if you PC updates, you may lose the mic function. If that happens, unplug the webcam from your USB on the PC, restart your PC then plug the webcam back in. That should return full function to the mic. You can't go wrong with the Logitech C920X.

title: DON'T BOTHER !!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 11, 2021
text: I have been searching for a webcam. One that actually works.  On the advice of a friend I upgraded, admittedly not to the same one she has, but still the same brand. Twice the money I had been spending, in the hope that I would at last find something good.  Well guess what...It arrived today.  I have tried to get this to work. No joy. The computer doesn't recognise it, it simply doesn't show up. I searched in different ways to try and locate it (with it plugged into differing USB ports), all with no result. It is simply invisible. So I watch some instructional videos on YouTube which tell me I must go to the Logitech website and download drivers for this camera (Why?).I go to the Logitech website. I look at manuals and instructions. very little in English, mostly in Chinese, totally unintelligible to me.  ....  How about just type in Logitech webcam drivers? Let's try that.So I go. And I look. I cannot find drivers for the C920x. There are drivers for C920 and C920s, but not for this one.I know, I thought, we'll just get the drivers for the C920 and go from there.  Round and round the houses on the Logitech website. The only option it will give me is to download GHub, which is basically for gaming as far as I can tell. Anyway, I download it.It wants me to do all sorts of things like register (which will include name, email etc), and to allow them access to my computer and share my data with them, and to share my gaming experiences with others, online. The thing won't let me proceed unless I agree.But I don't want to agree. I just want a camera such that when I plug it in it just works. I don't want to faff about registering and "Sharing" anything that has absolutely nothing to do with them nor anybody else.  So....  This thing is just another expensive paperweight.It's packed, sealed, and is going straight back where it came from tomorrow (well, today than 11th). Chinese crap.So disappointing.

title: Works great ... After you overcome all the glitches every time you use it.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 18, 2021
text: Got the camera, plugged it in, and it worked well. At first. The problem is 2 fold - (1) If you want to do any sort of customization (zooming in, focusing, exposure, etc.), it's quite a pain. I spent hours watching Youtube videos and researching how to change the settings before finally have to download and install software that finally let me change the settings. I thought I had overcome the issues, and now I was good to go ... However ... Problem number (2) ... Even after dialing in all my settings, the camera would continually "glitch" by randomly going dark, randomly over-exposing, going in and out of focus, cropping the image, etc. ... So, as I'm going live, it glitches, and I have to open up the software, reset everything, then dial it back in again. I went live on a live-stream 3-5 times in a row over 3 days, and there wasn't a single time it didn't have an issue while I was live-streaming that I didn't have to stop and say, "Hold on guys, let me go fix this real quick". To be fair, yes, once the glitches were handled, it worked great. But the fact that I had to do so much heavy lifting up front just to change a few settings and the fact that I have to overcome glitches on the fly every time I live-stream makes it simply not worth it. I'm now sending it back and either upgrading to the c922 or simply buying from a different retailer. I'm not sure if I just got a bum camera or what the deal is, but it is definitely not going to work long term as a reliable camera source.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black

title: Setup isn't easy but it works fine
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 16, 2021
text: There's only five pictures on the package to set this up but you will probably have at least five questions when you plug it in. Scratch around long enough and you can find the online manual. If you're a Mac user there is no manual... the Mac has the drivers built in so all you do is change the View setting in whatever app you're using (Zoom, or Facetime, or whatever). The camera won't show up in the Finder so be warned. Windows users need to download drivers and install. Once running, it's seamless.

I played around with substituting cool static backgrounds.  x-split also allows the substituting of a youtube video.  The funniest one put me in the front seat of a jeep and a T-Rex is chasing.

title: Prepare to pay extra for software
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2022
text: The camera is a good device.  I have no complaints with the quality of the picture.The problem is that the software is apparently not compatible with Windows 11, which is what Logitech Support told me.The Logitech Capture software is decent software.  When I try to use it with Windows 11, it has a simple but extremely irritating issue of regularly adjusting the input volume to 100 without me changing it.  This is beyond problematic.  It could damage my output devices, so this is an unacceptable flaw.When I reached out to Logitech Support, they said that Windows 11 wasn't compatible with Logitech Capture.  They recommended that I use LogiTune instead.After spending a few hours with the LogiTune software, I have no idea what it's even supposed to do.  My audio input device isn't showing up, and I can't find a way to even record from the software.I don't even care about the video quality that much.  It's all about the audio, and it turns out that my input device, an Audio Technica AT2020USB+, isn't compatible.  This is not only an extremely common condenser mic, but it is one of the two gold standards when it comes to condenser mic products.And LogiTune doesn't support the other one, either.So now I have to decide whether I want to buy a new camera that hopefully comes with some modern software that I can actually use, or if I want to actually buy some software that allows me to use the camera.

text: The "x" in the description and on the box is for the free 3 months of Xsplit software (via a code printed on a small pamphlet inside the box) and has nothing to do with the camera model. In the box is the Logitech C920 camera. I have it plugged into my Dell XPS 15 9500 (2020 model) running Windows 10 Pro and didn't have to install any drivers or software. I use it with Zoom. No pop ups, no errors, it's 100% plug n' play. Picture quality is a huge improvement from the base camera in my laptop. Crazy that in 2020 laptop camera quality is still an issue. Other than that, it's a webcam and performs as advertised.

title: Noise from INSIDE camera
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2023
text: I'm a psychologist doing telehealth. I bought this camera because I believed it to be an upgrade from the one I had to spontaneously buy when COVID first hit. However, very quickly after buying it, a noise began to disrupt my sessions. I couldn't hear the noise, but my clients could. At first I thought it was maybe my speakers, or just some other interfering electronic. But after troubleshooting many times, I finally put my ear up to the camera itself and I could hear the noise coming from within the camera. Of course, by the time I figured out what was actually happening, the return period had passed. I have now had to go back to my old camera. This was not worth the money.

title: Would-be great cam, ruined by flawed auto-focus
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
text: The build quality of this cam is good, I like the tripod mount.  Optics seem good, sound is reasonable.HOWEVER -The auto-focus is extremely unreliable!Not just the kind of auto-focus errors where it focuses on something else on the screen instead of you, or maybe loses the focus for a split second.  No - this is the kind where it focuses ALLLLL the way in, leaving your face quite blurred... and remains there for 2-3 minutes at a time.It didn't matter the level of light in the room, or whether I was only about 4' away from the camera (a normal desktop application), the auto-focus loses it unpredictably.  There's a way to add on software where you can disable it, but what's the point of having auto-focus in a camera, if the only way to trust the image, is to disable it?I give it only 2 stars because it does otherwise function.  But an auto-focus which goes off without warning is about as useful as a car which can't be steered, randomly, for about 2 minutes.  Doesn't matter how good the rest of the car is, if you can't trust it to steer properly ALL the time.

title: I expected so much more
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 5, 2021
text: I will say that Logitech products and I just don't seem to get along... I knew before I ordered this camera that I wouldn't like it, but it came recommended by a techie coworker, so I took a chance. This was meant to replace my old Logitech for which the company no longer supplies installation drivers.I got it, plugged it in, and turned on Zoom. Holy crap, it was bad. The camera zoomed in on my face as tightly as my old one had (which I hated) and it was pixellated as hell! I then tried to just open the Logitech webcam on my computer, thinking maybe it was a Zoom thing. I got a popup that said I was using the wrong kind of driver, and to download the Logitech driver instead. So I went to their website, and THERE WERE NO DRIVERS TO DOWNLOAD! Just some desktop app that gives me no control whatsoever over the webcam.I bought two cameras when I placed my order. This one, and another brand for $30. The cheaper one gave me a wider angle and a MUCH clearer video. So this one is being returned. Sorry, Logitech, it looks like it'll never work between us...

Some kind of a whine I could not hear on my side.Also the image went way out of focus during the presentation - something I had never experienced previously in any video conferencing setup.  It seems to have a focusing mechanism, and for some reason had real trouble with my set-up - maybe because I use a black backdrop?.

title: Auto Focus on ZOOM is TERRIBLE! DO NOT BUY!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2022
text: I do public speaking on Zoom and noticed that when I step back and increase distance, the camera randomly goes out of focus. I bought a second camera, assuming I had a bad one. Same issue. I have spent at least 20 hours researching this issue online, and have discovered many other people complaining about the zoom auto focus. The "workarounds" involve opening up the camera and manually disabling the auto focus (sorry, I am not that advanced), to buying add-ons to disable the program. The add-ons don't work. Especially Logitech Capture, so don't waste your time even trying it. This is otherwise a good camera but the autofocus issue on Zoom makes this camera worthless to me.

title: This camera is a scam. Save your money and time.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 21, 2022
text: There has to be some kind of grand conspiracy going on with this camera and Logitech, because this camera, from what I can tell, is absolutely horrible. Especially in lowlight conditions. It is frustrating, because this camera is rated as being excellent across multiple sites and even reviews on Amazon. But despite my best efforts to get this camera to work: Adjusting lighting, downloading Logitechs (outdated software, doesn't work for macOS 12) etc, but I have come to the conclusion that this camera is simply terrible and those reviews had a very low bar for quality.The dark photo is an actual photo taken from this webcam mounted on my monitor. The second photo is a photo taken from my 2021 Macbook Pro. Both were taken in the same room, same lighting conditions, about 2 minutes apart.Save your time and money. Skip this camera and buy something like the Lumina instead if you're looking for a decent webcam in 2022. Yes it's more expensive, but at least it's better than a laptop camera and works in lowlight.

Finally found download that Logitech says works for OS 10.13, downloaded it, MacBook says it is not compatible with OS 10.13. A lot of trouble for nothing.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
text: I'm a coach and a speaker so I use my MacBook internal camera for Zooms and other on-camera work daily. I bought this Logitech because I wanted a higher quality image than my laptop offers, but at a reasonable price and this one had good reviews. To my surprise, the Logitech image isn't any better than my laptop camera, but that's not really the reason for the poor rating. The actual issue is the Logitech camera randomly *turns itself off* during Zooms (!) even though I downloaded the control panel app (LogiTunes), which is recommended.Eek! That's never good. That situation means I can't trust it, and therefore I can't use it, but unfortunately I missed my return window by a week so I'm stuck with a camera I have no use for.  Would love to hear of anyone else with the issue who somehow fixed it.

title: DONT BUY IF YOU HAVE A MACBOOK OR IPAD
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2022
text: If I could give this product and its customer service 0 stars, I would. First of all the product description and question/answer section states that this product is compatible with apple products like MacBook and ipad. Well that is a complete LIE. The only way to connect the usb wire to a MacBook or iPad Pro is to use an adapter because the inputs on the devices are USB-C. Apparently the camera does not work when connected to an adapter. The customer service representative told me that the device is not compatible with ipad and cannot work with adapter. So the device is not defective (to best of my knowledge), but advertising is not truthful. Please dont make the same mistake as me by buying this product for apple devices.

text: Update - NOT GREAT!So finally the Omni TV has Zoom as an app, and it looks like everything is working fine until there is no way to zoom or adjust the camera settings on the tv. The camera should just work with Zoom, Skype, Teams, etc. Second, there does not appear to be a logitech app for the Omni TV app store, so this won't even apply to my case.Original Post -I bought an Omni TV which is supposed to have Zoom capability. title: Drivers (Logitech G HUB) do not work as intended after more than a year
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 25, 2021
text: The drivers and management tools for this camera are in an application named Logitech G HUB. This application is used to manage your camera's settings and without it the camera can look absolutely terrible. Unfortunately, the application does not work and you are unable to change settings such as the zoom, recentering, focus, exposure, etc.I bought this camera only a week ago, but after doing some researching it looks like this exact problem has been around for more than a year and a half without any fixes.Some recommendations from Logitech have been to instead use the Logitech Capture software, and have it running anytime you want to use your camera but this is not a fix. The settings that you set here do not work without Logitech Capture being up and running and many applications such as video chat application for work do not function with Logitech Capture.

text: I thought I'd do well to replace a very decent camera with the same model: WRONG! This thing has serious issues with over exposure and lesser issues with focus. My kid's $20 no-name camera does better. This constantly over-exposes my face (maybe trying to adjust to the beige wall behind me?). Also, at least once a week, it forgets how to autofocus and I have to move really close or far away until it 'figures it out'. It looks very unprofessional. I've downloaded the Logi tools, but adjustments are temporary and I don't want to spend my calls fiddling with settings instead of running a call. Overall, this is a disappointing step down from my last Logi webcam.

title: These used to be very good...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021
text: This review is for a Logitech C920 Webcam.I purchased this camera primarily because my company issued the C920 to its employees (pre-pandemic) and I needed one for home.  I'm not sure what happened, but the video quality of my new camera is much worse than the one I used at the office. Low light performance is abysmal. Contrasts are muddy. And the overall picture is really grainy.  Picture quality does improve a little if I add more sources of ambient light, but the improvement isn't enough to rate this product higher.Logitech definitely changed something with this model, maybe to accommodate the sudden demand. Regardless, the changes have been for the worse.  If you just need a webcam (and it's not overpriced due to unscrupulous third-party vendors), then you'll get by with this webcam.  But if you want a quality video feed, look elsewhere.

title: Product will not work with docking station.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 6, 2021
text: This product arrived with no instructions whatsoever. I installed it, but it wouldn't work. Checking the Logitech website, it says, "Make sure the camera isn't connected to a USB hub or docking station." Newer Mac laptops do not have a USB port. Therefore this camera cannot be used with a newer Mac except with a docking station. This was not clear in the Amazon description of the camera nor in the Wirecutter article, both declaring it to be the best and usable with both PCs and Macs. I will think twice about buying a Logitech product again. Since when don't devices come with basic installation instructions? We are not all tech wizards.

text: As soon as I received the item, something just didn't seem right.  The box seemed a little too beat-up. ..  But OK, i unboxed it & the camera looked legit.  Plugged it in & it detected as a C920 camera ... Not a C920x ...  but OK, maybe they use the same driver.  The problem came when I could not update the firmware and in certain programs, could not stop the flicker.  I then realized the 'serial number' and the 'part number' did NOT match what was on the box.  Concerned the camera could be phishing & hesitant to send it back.  Reaching out to Amazon for assistance

title: I have had no problems with this camera.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2023
text: I have been using this camera since it came out without issue. I have read some reviews where people complained about the audio and that somehow other microphones weren't compatible for use with this camera. I use both the built-in microphones and together with outboard microphones. One of the comments on a review below said something about gold standard microphones not working? That makes no sense to me since I use Pro Audio Equipment with mine using XLR mics through and audio interface. But, again I still use the built in mic for teleconferencing. The complaints seem to be software related? Don't understand that since you really don't need software other than the drivers unless  you are doing videos... in that case you are, like me, using separately purchased production software. For Zoom and other teleconferencing apps its only a matter of selecting your audio/video sources (same with production software). You may select those sources independently though any software package out there. If folks are relying on the packaged capture software then that's the problem. Packaged software with a webcam is not intended for much at all. There is plenty of low-cost/no-cost video software out there that kicks the crap out of any basic package that comes with a webcam. I do seem to remember some quirks with the logitech capture software when I tried it but that's pretty normal for ANY basic capture software. It ain't written to make movies. I bought a webcam, not their software besides the driver.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Auto-Focus causes constant noise on video calls
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
text: The auto-focus constantly moving on the camera gets picked up by the onboard microphone and makes an annoying clicking sound.  This renders this camera practically unusable.  There is a software tool to disable the auto-focus, but you have to disable it every time you have a new video call.  Picture quality is fine, and the auto-focus seems to work, but the movement of the lens on the camera generates noise that is annoying to all other call participants.

text: I had used a 720p webcam for most of the pandemic.  Recently I added another monitor and this 1080p webcam for another business venture I ran. I immediately started to receive comments about the clarity and quality of my new webcam photos.  I convinced many colleagues and clients to up their game as well.Using the higher quality camera is a gamechanger for those who do a a lot of virtual calls for business.  It is well worth the higher price given the impression and quality it makes on those with whom you are communicating.

title: Compatible with RPI 3 B, Raspberry PI OS lite 64 bit, and Motion/MotionEye Security Surveillance
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
text: I found my old Raspberry PI 3 B.  One SD Card, compatible PSU and This specific web cam later...PA-DOW! A highly functional and capable 24/7 security surveillance system, for my front door, becomes operational.  I have a ledge with window above my front door (inside my house.)  This Web Cam is mounted to a Zeadio Metal Mini Tripod with Zeadio Metal ball head mount.  With some minor tweaks to MotionEye web interface in terms of frame rate adjust and video quality settings, this camera is working great.  I'm limited to the RPI 3 specs, but I really don't care.  I found a use for the RPI 3B after shelving and forgetting about it  for 5 years .

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Doesn't swivel L/R, No zoom or pan, bad mic, autofocus has parkinsons
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 17, 2021
text: This used to be the best value webcam available. It delivers a crisp HD image. However, this isn't 5 years ago and now it isn't even worth purchasing except for very narrow application.It doesn't swivel. That's right. It doesn't move left or right. So, unless you are popping this on a monitor directly in front of you, it gives an odd angled view.It doesn't zoom or pan. The older versions functioned properly, but these days with windows 10 and Logitech's 3rd rate driver support, this camera no longer zooms or pans. The only thing I have found to work is LogiCapture. That's great if you want laggy software driving the zoom with a noticeable delay in video meetings. Otherwise, not so much.It constantly changes focus, goes out of focus, and doesn't want to correct unless you turn off the camera and turn it back on. I have adjusted every setting possible with no fix. Auto, increase, decrease, doesn't matter.The mic sounds like you are in the back row of a large theater.I have two of these cameras. The old one works perfectly. The new one is useless. They look the same in every way. My disappointment is immeasurable and every day using the new camera is ruined.In short: This has a great picture if you are directly in front of it the perfect distance away. If you aren't, this camera is complete junk in every possible functional way.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Not the best option, and cannot beat free
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 22, 2021
text: I bought one of these from another vendor hoping to upgrade my webcam experience.  At first I was impressed, the picture sure beat that of a real cheap model I have been using, and the software with zoom and pan settings was very nice to have as well.Then I noticed a significant lag between the video and sound as captured by the Logi software. After some research on the web I found a pretty convenient way to use an unused cell phone as a webcam as well. On the video front the cell phone with it's 13 mega pixel camera wins by leaps and bounds, but what about sound lag?  I made a few recordings with zoom to test the lag:  1) Webcam 920s direct - no substantial lag  2) Droidcamx - no substantial lag  3) Logi Capture virtual 920s - Very noticeable lag  [note I could not find a virtual audio source from the logi software]Since I want to use the zoom feature to focus the image mostly on myself I am left with a camera I will not use. It is clear that I will be using the cell phone for zoom from now on. Sending the C920s back is too much trouble. Instead it will go on the hand me down stack after less than a week.

title: Do they focus check these before shipping?
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 23, 2021
text: I am very disappointed! I have an older Logitech (probably 4 years old) with a similar body style and a Zeiss lens. Picture is the one on the right. I have issues with the microphone on the old one so I decided to go for the C920. Shelling out 70 bucks for a web cam seemed steep but I wanted good picture and good sound. Well, I plugged the camera in and no sound but a crappy picture (see left sample picture). After putzing around for almost an hour I noticed the label in the box (the user manual is Ikea style and rather useless) to download the LogiTune tool which is required to enable the mike. I did that and now I had sound and crappy picture. I was ready to send the camera back but found a blog that shows how to adjust the focus on these. To do that, you got to crack it open (so now my warranty is gone) but at least I am getting a somewhat better picture. I had bought (and sent back) a Chinese knock off that had the same focus issue.If you buy one: Download the LogiTune tool if you want a microphone and don't expect too much in regards to Image quality!

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022
text: I experience a lot of lag between the sound and the picture.  The sound is on time, the picture varies between in synch (rarely) and 2-3 seconds late (common). The C922 only offer a USB connection, but my Apple Macbook Air only has USB-C connections, so I must use an adaptor.  I suspect this is the problem, though without support from Logitech, i am not sure. The lag varies unpredictably throughout the day.  The lack of support is very, very disappointing.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Webcam's mic picks up autofocus mechanism, sends out loud noise
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
text: Randomly on conference calls, I would get a heads up from the group that my audio was making loud buzzing/grinding noises. It was sporadic, and I couldn't hear it, so it took me a while to isolate the cause: this webcam's mic is picking up some aspect of the camera's autofocus mechanism.If I turn off autofocus (set focus manually via the Win10 Camera App), the noise doesn't come back. I usually have my mic on mute for conference calls, which is the primary reason why the noise was so sporadic (autofocus would have to kick in while I was unmuted).Now that I know what the issue is, I can see that autofocus is definitely not a rare source of problems for C920 webcams. I've had pretty decent luck with other Logitech products (mice, keyboards, webcams) over the years, but their glaringly poor product design/QC of this webcam has soured me on the brand.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Great for 2 weeks, until it stopped working completely
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
text: I would stay away from this camera. I use it with Windows 10, and after about 2 weeks, it stopped working. It will come on intermittently and then stop. The browsers tell me that the camera failed, and half the time the driver does not show up in the Device Manager. I've tried every USB port on my computer, Logitech Capture, Logitech G Hub, uninstalling and reinstalling everything, removing the driver and letting Windows find it, and adjusting settings in Meet, Teams, Zoom, etc. Nothing works. Maybe I got a bad one; I don't know. Search online for "Logitech c920 webcam issues with Windows 10," and you will get hundreds or thousands of hits. I like Logitech products for the most part, but I will never buy another Logitech webcam after this experience.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Overexposes the image and bad software support
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
text: The camera terribly overexposes my face to the point where no face features are left. I have a window in front of my computer, so the background is quite a bit darker, but FWIW, my built-in MacBook camera looks just fine and doesn't overexpose a bit.Further, there is Logitech software, yes, but so many different products it's a labyrinth to navigate. Most Logitech software doesn't support changing EXPOSURE, but only BRIGHTNESS, which is useless once the image is overexposed. Only one software "Logitech G Hub" supports adjusting exposure, but it doesn't support exposure COMPENSATION, just manual exposure. So if you don't want to fiddle with the setting 10 times over the course of a day, it's useless.

title: Love it!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
text: Picked this up to replace the crappy one I bought during lockdown (and it was impossible to get anything quality at that point).The image is clear and the logi capture software works well for marking sure color and everything looks good while I'm video chatting with friends over discord. The only issue I DO have is a bit of delay, but it's sort of by choice. The capture software lets you pick to prioritize white balance or frame rate and I chose to sacrifice the frame rate so my neon backlighting is vivid! In natural light, it's no problem and the framerate is great. I don't stream, but I'd say it's casual streaming quality.Some people might not care, but I love how secure it is on my monitor. My old one had a short cable and just sort of sat, so it would fall all the time. This one is secure, doesn't slip, and looks very sleek on my setup! I've already recommended it to my friends!

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Plug and go, as described; great value
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021
text: I ordered this webcam for WebEx and MS Teams meetings that we have for work.  I took it out of the box maybe ten minutes before the WebEx today, and it worked like a charm.I used the virtual background, and there were issues there- if I moved from my original position, the silhouette of my head in the original position appeared on screen and other attendees could only see whatever part of me was in view within the silhouette sometimes.  Other times I could be seen fully, but the ‚Äúcut out‚Äù, as I‚Äôll refer to it, still remained on screen.  I am not 100% sure that‚Äôs due to the camera though.I also didn‚Äôt love the automatic light adjustment.  I changed it to manual, and it was much better.  That could be a WebEx issue though.Great camera for the price!  Nice picture, and super easy to use.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: Good quality camera, both picture and audio wise
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2022
text: I bought this camera for distance learning during the pandemic.  It's probably more than I needed, but I wanted to have good picture quality and be heard clearly.  My students said it did a great job of both.I'd prefer a less wide-angle picture because I wanted the camera to focus more on me, but it ended up projecting a wide swath behind me.  Oh well.Setting up the camera was easy.  Just plug it in and it powers up, then check your settings on whatever online meeting program you're using.  It sits securely on top of my monitor and it hasn't fallen off once, even if I shake my desk or monitor violently.  Note that there's no camera cover provided, so I use a piece of Post-It Note.

title: Excellent quality. webcam
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2021
text: I tried the no-name brand ones that were less expensive and had to return them.  In this instance, you get what you pay for.  This Logitech webcam is still not too expensive (~$60) but has all the quality.  I've had it for a month now.  The picture quality and auto focus are excellent, and the speakers work perfectly too.  It was very easy to use, just plug and play if you don't want to have the camera zoom in.  Otherwise, I hear you have to download the LogiCapture app to zoom in, which sounds easy so I may try it soon.  I'm really happy with this webcam.

text: Decided to add a webcam to my Dell XPS 8300 running Windows 10 Pro (64bit).  After connecting the Logitech C920x to a vacant USB port and going to <Camera> to make sure it was capturing video and to <Settings> <Sound> to make sure the webcam's microphone was accessable, I was up and running. title: Quality
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2022
text: This is one of two go to cameras for the office. The picture quality is great and the onboard microphones pick up voice like you are wearing a headset, which is perfect for those who hate using a headset.The only thing to watch is the angle of view. This unit produces a much wider view of the subject matter and will frequently pickup more of the office background that you want. This is why it is one of two office favorites (the other is a narrower angle). I typically put it in place and open the default windows camera application to show the user what others will see on a call. This frequently turn into an office cleaning session üòâ

title: Same Problem the Last One Had
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2022
text: I bought this to replace my other Logitech camera that had developed a rattle. Well, guess what? This one rattles, too! Apparently not as bad as the last one, but super disappointed that this camera seems to have the same issue. Now I'm on the lookout for a good webcam that isn't a cruddy Logitech.  When these cameras work - they work great. When they don't -- they really don't.  There is no reason a brand new camera out of the box should be rattling. You can't tell me I happened to get 2 bad cameras with the same problem with two years of space between them.  It's a bad product - period.

title: Can't go wrong here

text: Very crisp clear video, and works great on almost any OS. I tested on Linux and 1080p gets choppy at 5fps, but on other OS's it works great. Surprisingly clear for a 1080p webcam. Just remember if you are going for a high resolution such as a 4k camera, those resolutions are hard to keep cool; that is, 4k webcams run very hot and are more prone to failure. If you really want to go that high you'll want to use a SLR or other kind of device that is prepared for such processing requirements.

title: Best of a bad bunch - could be better, but easiest to use
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 22, 2021
text: The C920 series in the end is the best of a bad bunch. Personally I think the Wirecutter and other sites oversell this as it pales in comparison to using a full fledged camera as a webcam. It is a bit better than the internal camera on a Dell laptop, but the mic is very poor in comparison, so I would rely on an external USB mic instead. This unfortunately is common across all webcams.Out of box, this has the best quality of any webcams I tested between Nexigo N660P which was about neck and neck with this, it it weren‚Äôt that the default settings and software were ultimately a let down. Make no mistake, the C920 is not the best camera at all, but it is the best and easiest dedicated webcam to use at its price point. Probably the Brio is going to be much better but it is also about 4 times more expensive.Also I do prefer to to adjust the settings just a bit to increase the saturation and contrast, otherwise it is fine and no one will notice or care much either way.I have purchased the C920S after returning this one since the S has the lens cover which is necessary for privacy. One thing no one mentions is that there is a slight Bokeh effect in the far distance of the image: this is good for taking away attention from the background and putting focus on you as the subject, but subjectively for image quality the N660P looks better because it has edge to edge sharpness.I only kept this over the N660P because the default settings were acceptable while the N660P default were a bit bad. This itself makes it easier to use because most if not all webcams will reset to default after the computer is reset which is a critical issue - the only resolution is a bit of burdensome programming, or a proprietary software that may or may not be available or even recommended.

title: It seems this is counterfeit (and you will not have a warranty). Be aware!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2021
text: As you can see in my photo, serial numbers on the device and on the box are different. Part numbers are also different! Moreover, part number on the device label (860-000560) is NOT listed on the official logitech site. Sometimes that happens with third-party sellers, but I have never expected it when I see "Sold by Amazon''.I hope support service will step into and explain it. I'm in doubt about authenticity and about warranty.The camera arrived in the crushed box (see the photo). I don't know why the camera still works :)Oh, yea - there are no more Zeiss lenses any longer - as I have in my 3-years old c920 Logitech - although price is the same and higher. Just some lens. Video quality is getting much worse - I connected old and new cameras to my laptop and have the opportunity to compare both on the same scenes.Autofocus sometimes lagged - not focused in time or not focused on me - what they "improved" from 2017?Disappointed, but I need it for everyday work. Stay tuned.

text: Awesome camera.  I buy almost nothing but Logitech products in terms of peripherals.  This camera model in particular, I've had to do a bit of research due to the number of different camera products they have.  C920 was definitely the product of choice.  Not available through Logitech's site or Amazon page, and was lucky to have found this reseller that have a few in stock!  Delivery was faster than expected with no issues at all.I use the camera primarily for all of my virtual meetings and the quality and features are great!  Picture is so clear and integrates perfectly fine with Zoom and other video conference software.  Mic is quite sensitive as well, I don't realize how much it picks up when my other family members are close by.  I definitely recommend this product to anyone!

text: Very poor video quality. I'm not sure if mine was defective, but it was only able to focus on things that were 6+ feet away from my screen. I sit 2 feet in front of the screen, so you can see how that didn't work out for me.

product_name: Logitech C920x HD Pro Webcam, Full HD 1080p/30fps Video Calling, Clear Stereo Audio, HD Light Correction, Works with Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, Hangouts, PC/Mac/Laptop/Macbook/Tablet - Black
title: What a disappointment
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021
text: I've been using a $20 no-name camera over the months of the pandemic waiting for the price of this to come down.I finally get one, plugged it in and the camera simply wouldn't focus on me. I am using it with an M1 MacBook Air in clamshell mode. I sit about 2 feet from the screen and have a huge amount of light. I am always slightly out of focus. It also loses focus quite often and starts seeking around the room. There is little backlight to confuse it and I am much closer than the background. The $20 camera with fixed focus at least didn't have this issue. If I move my face within 1 feet it will actually focus and I am given a tantalizing glance of how good the camera could be. Then I sit back into a more normal position and it loses it again. I even tried paying $8 for the webcam settings app on the Mac App Store. That allowed me to turn off auto-focus. Unfortunately, even in manual focus, it can't focus on me sitting 2 feet away. What a waste of money.Update: Via web chat I had a rather frustrating conversation with Logitech customer service. Eventually, they told me I probably had a dodgy unit, so should get it replaced. I ordered another and compared the 2. No discernible difference. Neither can properly focus beyond about a foot. I will keep one of them, as there doesn't appear to be any better options on the market. Don't expect this thing to be very sharp though. Hopefully another company will invent a camera that can focus properly.
